item.title: Trailer carrying motorhome, plus forklift attachment abandoned on Rochester Way, 8th December
item.description:
Trailer, motorhome and forklift attachment abandoned in CPZ on Rochester Way opposite electricity substation for more than a month. There seems to have been several reports but no apparent action by the council to resolve. The trailer is not lit. Neither is the motorhome nor the forklift attachment. As such these are in contravention of parking rules. As this had persisted for more than a month , this does not seem to be a short term issue. Long-term storage of trailers on the highway is not permitted so the council must take action to resolve..noting that the costs of removal can be recovered from the owner. The vehicle with the same plates as the trailer is validly registered
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Rochester Way, Eltham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned VOI bike, 8th December
item.description:
This VOI bike has been at this location for many weeks, sometimes laying on the floor or leant against a wall, if it falls on a child it will cause serious injury as it is so heavy, have reported to VOI website many times but still at location.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victoria Street, Upper Belvedere, Greater London

item.title: Manhole cover rattling not been fixed properly, 8th December
item.description:
About ten residents in this area have reported this manhole cover as loose. It was very poorly fixed itâ€™s broken again. This is constantly keeping me and my kids awake at night. I am seriously considering going to my solicitor at this stage over this as none of us can bare to live every day with this constant banging.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kennington Lane, Kennington, Greater London

item.title: Vandal Tagged Buildings in Full Sight of Park Users While Scaffolding Was Up., 8th December
item.description:
Vandals have tagged the side of Oldbury Court while scaffold was up on for repairs, meaning that the ugly tag is now 2 stories up and hard to remove. Why didn't the estate manager or repairs team see this and fix it while the scaffold was still up? Remove.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Mabley Street, Hackney, London
